Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Lynne F
Reviews.Content: I was surprised by some of the reviews as I found this hotel offered excellent value for money. Yes, the single rooms are not large, but for one person I found the room more than adequate. Before I discovered Infanta Mercedes I was in a hotel with a much larger room, but breakfast there was 18 euros, wifi was slow and the price was a third as much again. While Tetuan is not a posh area, it is a regular neighbourhood and I never felt unsafe. It's also only 10 mins walk to the metro. Everything was clean, there was a bath/shower with plenty of hot water. I like that they have soap dispensers rather than little toiletries - much more eco-friendly. I enjoyed free wifi 24 hrs a day which was very fast & reliable. The buffet breakfast is included in the price and the selection was wonderful. Fresh fruit, cereal, hot food, cold food, pastries, all nicely presented. A great way to start one's day. Reception staff always very helpful and courteous. Loved the bowl of sweets on the reception desk. There is a lift in the lobby. My only concern was that I could hear other guests through the walls/ceiling, but that didn't overly detract from what I found to be the best value for money in the area. Each guest will weigh up what is important to him/her - for me as a seasoned traveller, I would definitely return here when in Madrid again. Sometimes it's the little things that make a difference and for me Hotel Infanta Mercedes served all my needs and more. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel for a couple of days cause we wanted a city brake. It is located in a quite area of the city with a small square. Is situated close to a number of top sights in Madrid, including the Paseo de la Castellana, the Bernabeu football stadium, Congress Center and Plaza Castilla Square. Well-sized room with extremely comfortable beds, good bathroom with hairdryer, free wifi and good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: EscritorManchester
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as I had some surplus Sol points and we wanted a city break. Hotel is in Tetuan and is not in a tourist area. However you do get a feel of how madrileños live. We sat in the big square one evening letting our daughter play with other local children and talked to some of the locals. The area felt safe but use common sense as in any city. Room was basic but clean and quiet. Breakfast was ok. Hotel is 10 mins walk from underground. Madrid is a great city, fantastic art galleries. Barcelona pips it on looks and atmosphere though

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless......”
Reviews.Author: ajgoldar
Reviews.Content: Quite street but rooms poorly noise aisolated. Central heating is turned off, you have to guess how to turn it on..... Strong smell of black waters in the bathroom. Apart from that...... value for money

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Ximena S
Reviews.Content: If you want to hear what your neighbor is doing and also be told when can you feel warm or cold, this is your place! Although the location is good, it doesn't compensate for the nights without sleep. The walls of the hotel are paper thin and the street noise can be heard clearly. Now, the breakfast buffet is worth the price for the variety of fruit and pastries, but the sleepless nights or when you think that somebody is entering your room it is unbearable. Have sleeping pills handy when staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: BM2210
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, clean hotel away from the busy centre of Madrid but everything is easily accessible by metro which is 10 mins walk away from the hotel (Tetuan metro). If you don’t wished to be disturbed early in the morning, use the Do Not Disturb sign. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Internet available but was only €3 for the length of my stay which was 3 nights. Didnt have the breakfast as i was out late and up late but there a few places opposite and around the hotel where you can eat...delicious, generous portions at reasonable prices. All in all, very good value for money and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “exactly what it said it would be”
Reviews.Author: MoloKenya
Reviews.Content: close to tube station close to where I was to meet a group very quiet room - absolutely no traffic noise The thunderstorm was beyond the management's control!!! all in all 10 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Modern,clean,functional”
Reviews.Author: nano96
Reviews.Content: A drawback is its location (Tetuan) fairly far from the city center, but there is a subway station close-by. Rooms are rather small but modern, very clean and with all the necessary equipment..Very quiet (had a room facing the yard) as is the neighborhood. Beds are good. Free wifi works perfectly well in the rooms and the whole building. Unfortunately breakfast is quite average. Staff very pleasant but don't ask for a wake-up call, they will just forget...

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: WillWork4Travel
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Front desk was always helpful and rooms along with the hotel very clean. There was a little mix up in my room, so the next night I was placed in a room closest to the street and sometimes it got a little loud in the evening because there is a little park in front. Not too big of a deal. I would recommend this hotel to a friend and/or stay again. The metro stop (Tetuan) near the hotel isn't super close, but just far enough from the heart of Madrid. Breakfast buffet isn't free, but it is good with a lot of variety. Not sure it is worth the 10euros every morning. Yes, it is a little annoying that wi-fi has to be paid for. I think it was only 3euros my entire stay, not much, but still a little annoying. Really though, this was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for very nice hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Catherine K
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very very affordable considering it has a restaurant on site, room service, a good breakfast, and very helpful front desk staff. Rooms are very clean, comfortable beds, and great bath. I love the quiet, safe, location that is near Tetuan metro line that goes directly to the center of Madrid. It is also very close to Vaughan Systems meeting point. After 10yrs of coming to Madrid, I now have found the hotel that I will be staying for my every visit. It is a great value for such a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: fjlimg
Reviews.Content: My second stay here the first time was when it was part of the Sol Chain of hotels...have great people at reception and gladly gave me an early check - in which was great because I had an early flight.. Overall its a good budget hotel and used normally by businessmen visiting Madrid. The only downside was they start cleaning rooms at 9 a.m. sometimes noisy after a heavy night out..

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in quiet area”
Reviews.Author: lizvincent
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night after attending a family wedding outside Madrid. The hotel was in a quiet residential area of Madrid as we were visiting family near there that evening. We arrived around midday and were given our room immediately. Decent size with adequate bathroom, very clean and comfortable. Parking in the street and, as it was a Sunday, it was free until the following morning from 9.00 a.m., then payable. The hotel did not have its own car park so, if travelling by car, you would need to keep this in mind. However, it was fairly near the Metro system for travelling into the historic centre of Madrid. We didn't eat dinner there but there the breakfast was excellent - good choice of dishes with fresh fruit, eggs, pastries, etc. and excellent coffee (even though from a machine!). Friendly reception staff. We found it good value for a capital city hotel - we paid E70 for double room and breakfast. Small typical family restaurants nearby for eating out.

Reviews.Title: “solid hotel, good price”
Reviews.Author: pessachayah
Reviews.Content: This was the 1st hotel I stayed in in Spain. At first I thought it should have included some xtras (wifi specifically, for which you have to pay by the hour or day and since I was working on a thesis I was pissed). But after staying in several other similarly priced hotels in Spain, I decided Mercedes is pretty nice. Location is good, not in the center of Madrid but trust me, you don't want to stay in Sol unless you plan on partying 'til 3am every night. The metro in Madrid makes it easy to get anywhere & the neighborhood has charm, also pretty quiet. Taxes included in price, very clean, nice bathroom & giant tub. Overall a solid hotel. You do have to pay for breakfast & wifi like I said but they are upfront about all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in a quiet neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Quentin1
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides clean, safe, quiet accommodation very close (by Metro and bus) to Madrid's tourist centres, but far enough away from them to largely avoid the hassles that accompany being in the very heart of the city. The hotel is in a residential neighbourhood that has all necessary shops and other services (hairdressers, dry cleaner, etc.), and is a five-minute walk from the nearest Metro station, with fast and regular connections to all parts of the city. Rooms are not huge -- I had an attic double for single use and wouldn't have liked to have shared it with anybody due to space limitations. Having said that, the room is provided with all the usual amenities, as well as heating and a/c, the bathroom is fully equipped (includes bath and bidet, items often left out of tourist hotel bathrooms nowadays given space considerations), and the room was extremely quiet. In fact, waking up in the morning to the sound of sparrows cheeping and a neighbour's chickens clucking around made it seem like a countryside hotel. Although breakfast is provided in the hotel at an extra charge, guests can hop across the road to the large bar that is directly in front of the hotel's front door and have breakfast and other meals there at reasonable prices. There are another couple of restaurants on the same street, in the direction of the Metro station. This is not a luxury hotel where you'd stay if you're seeking a five-star experience or a special honeymoon, for example. What it does offer is excellent value for money, excellent service from reception (nothing was too much bother for the staff), and a very quiet, safe environment in a nice residential neighbourhood which provides a new and refreshing take on Madrid if you're weary of staying in the noisy, dirty tourist centre which is plagued by pickpockets.

Reviews.Title: “Near the Bernabou.”
Reviews.Author: Chimper123
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel 10 mins from the Bernabou Stadium. You could compare it with a holiday express inn - modern style with all the facilities you would need for a short stay. There is a nice Irish Bar just 5 mins away if don't feel like going into the centre of Madrid. The reception staff were very helpful with directions and local info. Nuevos Ministerios Metro station (at the end of the airport line) is a 15 minute walk and takes 10 mins from Madrid airport costing 2 euro's. All in all this hotel was perfect for a trip to see Real Madrid. You can pick up the Madrid Vision open top tour bus from the Bernabou Stadium which I definitely reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “May Bank holiday”
Reviews.Author: melza
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tryp Infanta Mercedes on the 2nd may to the 5th with 5 other friends. The hotel is nice, it looks to be very recently renovated in a modern style.It is near Tetuan Metro stop and NOWHERE close to the Prado Museum or Botanical gardens like the info I found on the web said. It is near some great shopping and also a cool flea market that is held on sundays.The room I got given absolutely reeked of cigarettes and all the rooms are smoking rooms. The guy at reception was very nice and allowed us to move rooms to one that was much less fragrant.Easy to get into town on the Metro blue line, goes straight to Sol which is the centre of the shopping area and very easy to navigate to the tube from the hotel, I'd say max 5 min walk. It's also right near some supermarkets which is handy if you want some snacks and bottles of water etc as convienience stores were few and far between in this area.All up I'd say it is worth staying there, I only chose it was it was part of a package tour, otherwise I may have chosen somewhere more central. The corridors are a little noisy and the aircon wasn't working either.
